intro: Stachys pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican hedge nettle, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features square stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Stachys pittieri is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
